00078 /****************** persistent mount data *********************/

00080 #define LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT   0x0001
00081 #define LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST   0x0002
00082 #define LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MGS   0x0004
00083 #define LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MASK (LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT  | \
00084                             LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST  | \
00085                             LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MGS)
00086 #define LDD_F_SV_ALL        0x0008
00087 
00088 #define LDD_F_NEED_INDEX    0x0010
00089 
00090 #define LDD_F_VIRGIN        0x0020
00091 
00092 #define LDD_F_UPDATE        0x0040
00093 
00094 #define LDD_F_REWRITE_LDD   0x0080
00095 
00096 #define LDD_F_WRITECONF     0x0100
00097 
00098 #define LDD_F_UPGRADE14     0x0200
00099 
00100 #define LDD_F_PARAM         0x0400
00101 
00102 #define LDD_F_NO_PRIMNODE   0x1000
00103 
00104 #define LDD_F_IR_CAPABLE    0x2000
00105 
00106 #define LDD_F_ERROR         0x4000
00107 
00108 #define LDD_F_PARAM2            0x8000
00109 
00110 /* opc for target register */
00111 #define LDD_F_OPC_REG   0x10000000
00112 #define LDD_F_OPC_UNREG 0x20000000
00113 #define LDD_F_OPC_READY 0x40000000
00114 #define LDD_F_OPC_MASK  0xf0000000
00115 
00116 #define LDD_F_ONDISK_MASK  (LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MASK)
00117 
00118 #define LDD_F_MASK          0xFFFF

00120 enum ldd_mount_type {
00121         LDD_MT_EXT3 = 0,
00122         LDD_MT_LDISKFS,
00123         LDD_MT_SMFS,
00124         LDD_MT_REISERFS,
00125         LDD_MT_LDISKFS2,
00126         LDD_MT_ZFS,
00127         LDD_MT_LAST
00128 };
00129 
00130 static inline char *mt_str(enum ldd_mount_type mt)
00131 {
00132         static char *mount_type_string[] = {
00133                 "ext3",
00134                 "ldiskfs",
00135                 "smfs",
00136                 "reiserfs",
00137                 "ldiskfs2",
00138                 "zfs",
00139         };
00140         return mount_type_string[mt];
00141 }
00142 
00143 static inline char *mt_type(enum ldd_mount_type mt)
00144 {
00145         static char *mount_type_string[] = {
00146                 "osd-ldiskfs",
00147                 "osd-ldiskfs",
00148                 "osd-smfs",
00149                 "osd-reiserfs",
00150                 "osd-ldiskfs",
00151                 "osd-zfs",
00152         };
00153         return mount_type_string[mt];
00154 }

00156 #define LDD_INCOMPAT_SUPP 0
00157 #define LDD_ROCOMPAT_SUPP 0
00158 
00159 #define LDD_MAGIC 0x1dd00001
00160 
00161 /* On-disk configuration file. In host-endian order. */
00162 struct lustre_disk_data {
00163         __u32      ldd_magic;
00164         __u32      ldd_feature_compat;  /* compatible feature flags */
00165         __u32      ldd_feature_rocompat;/* read-only compatible feature flags */
00166         __u32      ldd_feature_incompat;/* incompatible feature flags */
00167 
00168         __u32      ldd_config_ver;      /* config rewrite count - not used */
00169         __u32      ldd_flags;           /* LDD_SV_TYPE */
00170         __u32      ldd_svindex;         /* server index (0001), must match
00171                                            svname */
00172         __u32      ldd_mount_type;      /* target fs type LDD_MT_* */
00173         char       ldd_fsname[64];      /* filesystem this server is part of,
00174                                            MTI_NAME_MAXLEN */
00175         char       ldd_svname[64];      /* this server's name (lustre-mdt0001)*/
00176         __u8       ldd_uuid[40];        /* server UUID (COMPAT_146) */
00177 
00178 /*200*/ char       ldd_userdata[1024 - 200]; /* arbitrary user string */
00179 /*1024*/__u8       ldd_padding[4096 - 1024];
00180 /*4096*/char       ldd_mount_opts[4096]; /* target fs mount opts */
00181 /*8192*/char       ldd_params[4096];     /* key=value pairs */
00182 };
00183 
00184 
00185 #define IS_MDT(data)    ((data)->lsi_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT)
00186 #define IS_OST(data)    ((data)->lsi_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST)
00187 #define IS_MGS(data)    ((data)->lsi_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MGS)
00188 #define IS_SERVER(data) ((data)->lsi_flags & (LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MGS | \
00189                          LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT | LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST))
00190 #define MT_STR(data)    mt_str((data)->ldd_mount_type)
00191 
00192 /* Make the mdt/ost server obd name based on the filesystem name */
00193 static inline int server_make_name(__u32 flags, __u16 index, char *fs,
00194                                    char *name)
00195 {
00196         if (flags & (LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT | LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST)) {
00197                 if (!(flags & LDD_F_SV_ALL))
00198                         sprintf(name, "%.8s%c%s%04x", fs,
00199                                 (flags & LDD_F_VIRGIN) ? ':' :
00200                                         ((flags & LDD_F_WRITECONF) ? '=' : '-'),
00201                                 (flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT) ? "MDT" : "OST",
00202                                 index);
00203         } else if (flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MGS) {
00204                 sprintf(name, "MGS");
00205         } else {
00206                 CERROR("unknown server type %#x\n", flags);
00207                 return 1;
00208         }
00209         return 0;
00210 }

00212 /****************** mount command *********************/
00213 
00214 /* The lmd is only used internally by Lustre; mount simply passes
00215    everything as string options */
00216 
00217 #define LMD_MAGIC               0xbdacbd03
00218 #define LMD_PARAMS_MAXLEN       4096
00219 
00220 /* gleaned from the mount command - no persistent info here */
00221 struct lustre_mount_data {
00222         __u32   lmd_magic;
00223         __u32   lmd_flags;      /* lustre mount flags */
00224         int     lmd_mgs_failnodes; /* mgs failover node count */
00225         int     lmd_exclude_count;
00226         int     lmd_recovery_time_soft;
00227         int     lmd_recovery_time_hard;
00228         char   *lmd_dev;        /* device name */
00229         char   *lmd_profile;    /* client only */
00230         char   *lmd_fileset;    /* mount fileset */
00231         char   *lmd_mgssec;     /* sptlrpc flavor to mgs */
00232         char   *lmd_opts;       /* lustre mount options (as opposed to
00233                                  * device_ mount options) */
00234         char   *lmd_params;     /* lustre params */
00235         __u32  *lmd_exclude;    /* array of OSTs to ignore */
00236         char   *lmd_mgs;        /* MGS nid */
00237         char   *lmd_osd_type;   /* OSD type */
00238 };
00239 
00240 #define LMD_FLG_SERVER          0x0001  /* Mounting a server */
00241 #define LMD_FLG_CLIENT          0x0002  /* Mounting a client */
00242 #define LMD_FLG_SKIP_LFSCK      0x0004  /* NOT auto resume LFSCK when mount */
00243 #define LMD_FLG_ABORT_RECOV     0x0008  /* Abort recovery */
00244 #define LMD_FLG_NOSVC           0x0010  /* Only start MGS/MGC for servers,
00245                                            no other services */
00246 #define LMD_FLG_NOMGS           0x0020  /* Only start target for servers, reusing
00247                                            existing MGS services */
00248 #define LMD_FLG_WRITECONF       0x0040  /* Rewrite config log */
00249 #define LMD_FLG_NOIR            0x0080  /* NO imperative recovery */
00250 #define LMD_FLG_NOSCRUB         0x0100  /* Do not trigger scrub automatically */
00251 #define LMD_FLG_MGS             0x0200  /* Also start MGS along with server */
00252 #define LMD_FLG_IAM             0x0400  /* IAM dir */
00253 #define LMD_FLG_NO_PRIMNODE     0x0800  /* all nodes are service nodes */
00254 #define LMD_FLG_VIRGIN          0x1000  /* the service registers first time */
00255 #define LMD_FLG_UPDATE          0x2000  /* update parameters */
00256 #define LMD_FLG_HSM             0x4000  /* Start coordinator */
00257 
00258 #define lmd_is_client(x) ((x)->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_CLIENT)
00259 
00260 
00261 /****************** last_rcvd file *********************/
00262 
00264 #define LR_EPOCH_BITS   32
00265 #define lr_epoch(a) ((a) >> LR_EPOCH_BITS)
00266 #define LR_EXPIRE_INTERVALS 16 
00267 #define ENOENT_VERSION 1 
00269 #define LR_SERVER_SIZE   512
00270 #define LR_CLIENT_START 8192
00271 #define LR_CLIENT_SIZE   128
00272 #if LR_CLIENT_START < LR_SERVER_SIZE
00273 #error "Can't have LR_CLIENT_START < LR_SERVER_SIZE"
00274 #endif
00275 
00276 /*
00277  * This limit is arbitrary (131072 clients on x86), but it is convenient to use
00278  * 2^n * PAGE_CACHE_SIZE * 8 for the number of bits that fit an order-n allocation.
00279  * If we need more than 131072 clients (order-2 allocation on x86) then this
00280  * should become an array of single-page pointers that are allocated on demand.
00281  */
00282 #if (128 * 1024UL) > (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE * 8)
00283 #define LR_MAX_CLIENTS (128 * 1024UL)
00284 #else
00285 #define LR_MAX_CLIENTS (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE * 8)
00286 #endif
00287 
00289 #define OBD_COMPAT_OST          0x00000002
00290 
00291 #define OBD_COMPAT_MDT          0x00000004
00292 
00293 #define OBD_COMPAT_20           0x00000008
00294 
00296 #define OBD_ROCOMPAT_LOVOBJID           0x00000001
00297 
00298 #define OBD_ROCOMPAT_IDX_IN_IDIF        0x00000002
00299 
00301 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_GROUPS     0x00000001
00302 
00303 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_OST        0x00000002
00304 
00305 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_MDT        0x00000004
00306 
00307 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_COMMON_LR  0x00000008
00308 
00309 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_FID        0x00000010
00310 
00311 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_SOM        0x00000020
00312 
00313 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_IAM_DIR    0x00000040
00314 
00315 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_LMA        0x00000080
00316 
00321 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_LMM_VER    0x00000100
00322 
00323 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_MULTI_OI   0x00000200
00324 
00325 #define OBD_INCOMPAT_MULTI_RPCS 0x00000400
00326 
00327 /* Data stored per server at the head of the last_rcvd file.  In le32 order.
00328    This should be common to filter_internal.h, lustre_mds.h */
00329 struct lr_server_data {
00330         __u8  lsd_uuid[40];        /* server UUID */
00331         __u64 lsd_last_transno;    /* last completed transaction ID */
00332         __u64 lsd_compat14;        /* reserved - compat with old last_rcvd */
00333         __u64 lsd_mount_count;     /* incarnation number */
00334         __u32 lsd_feature_compat;  /* compatible feature flags */
00335         __u32 lsd_feature_rocompat;/* read-only compatible feature flags */
00336         __u32 lsd_feature_incompat;/* incompatible feature flags */
00337         __u32 lsd_server_size;     /* size of server data area */
00338         __u32 lsd_client_start;    /* start of per-client data area */
00339         __u16 lsd_client_size;     /* size of per-client data area */
00340         __u16 lsd_subdir_count;    /* number of subdirectories for objects */
00341         __u64 lsd_catalog_oid;     /* recovery catalog object id */
00342         __u32 lsd_catalog_ogen;    /* recovery catalog inode generation */
00343         __u8  lsd_peeruuid[40];    /* UUID of MDS associated with this OST */
00344         __u32 lsd_osd_index;       /* index number of OST in LOV */
00345         __u32 lsd_padding1;        /* was lsd_mdt_index, unused in 2.4.0 */
00346         __u32 lsd_start_epoch;     /* VBR: start epoch from last boot */
00348         __u64 lsd_trans_table[LR_EXPIRE_INTERVALS];
00350         __u32 lsd_trans_table_time; /* time of first slot in table above */
00351         __u32 lsd_expire_intervals; /* LR_EXPIRE_INTERVALS */
00352         __u8  lsd_padding[LR_SERVER_SIZE - 288];
00353 };
00354 
00355 /* Data stored per client in the last_rcvd file.  In le32 order. */
00356 struct lsd_client_data {
00357         __u8  lcd_uuid[40];      /* client UUID */
00358         __u64 lcd_last_transno; /* last completed transaction ID */
00359         __u64 lcd_last_xid;     /* xid for the last transaction */
00360         __u32 lcd_last_result;  /* result from last RPC */
00361         __u32 lcd_last_data;    /* per-op data (disposition for open &c.) */
00362         /* for MDS_CLOSE requests */
00363         __u64 lcd_last_close_transno; /* last completed transaction ID */
00364         __u64 lcd_last_close_xid;     /* xid for the last transaction */
00365         __u32 lcd_last_close_result;  /* result from last RPC */
00366         __u32 lcd_last_close_data;    /* per-op data */
00367         /* VBR: last versions */
00368         __u64 lcd_pre_versions[4];
00369         __u32 lcd_last_epoch;
00370         /* generation counter of client slot in last_rcvd */
00371         __u32 lcd_generation;
00372         __u8  lcd_padding[LR_CLIENT_SIZE - 128];
00373 };
00374 
00375 
00376 /* Data stored in each slot of the reply_data file.
00377  *
00378  * The lrd_client_gen field is assigned with lcd_generation value
00379  * to allow identify which client the reply data belongs to.
00380  */
00381 struct lsd_reply_data {
00382         __u64   lrd_transno;    /* transaction number */
00383         __u64   lrd_xid;        /* transmission id */
00384         __u64   lrd_data;       /* per-operation data */
00385         __u32   lrd_result;     /* request result */
00386         __u32   lrd_client_gen; /* client generation */
00387 };
00388 
00389 /* Header of the reply_data file */
00390 #define LRH_MAGIC 0xbdabda01
00391 struct lsd_reply_header {
00392         __u32   lrh_magic;
00393         __u32   lrh_header_size;
00394         __u32   lrh_reply_size;
00395         __u8    lrh_pad[sizeof(struct lsd_reply_data) - 12];
00396 };
00397 
00398 
00399 /* bug20354: the lcd_uuid for export of clients may be wrong */
00400 static inline void check_lcd(char *obd_name, int index,
00401                              struct lsd_client_data *lcd)
00402 {
00403         size_t length = sizeof(lcd->lcd_uuid);
00404         if (strnlen((char*)lcd->lcd_uuid, length) == length) {
00405                 lcd->lcd_uuid[length - 1] = '\0';
00406 
00407                 LCONSOLE_ERROR("the client UUID (%s) on %s for exports"
00408                                "stored in last_rcvd(index = %d) is bad!\n",
00409                                lcd->lcd_uuid, obd_name, index);
00410         }
00411 }
00412 
00413 /* last_rcvd handling */
00414 static inline void lsd_le_to_cpu(struct lr_server_data *buf,
00415                                  struct lr_server_data *lsd)
00416 {
00417         int i;
00418         memcpy(lsd->lsd_uuid, buf->lsd_uuid, sizeof(lsd->lsd_uuid));
00419         lsd->lsd_last_transno     = le64_to_cpu(buf->lsd_last_transno);
00420         lsd->lsd_compat14         = le64_to_cpu(buf->lsd_compat14);
00421         lsd->lsd_mount_count      = le64_to_cpu(buf->lsd_mount_count);
00422         lsd->lsd_feature_compat   = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_feature_compat);
00423         lsd->lsd_feature_rocompat = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_feature_rocompat);
00424         lsd->lsd_feature_incompat = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_feature_incompat);
00425         lsd->lsd_server_size      = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_server_size);
00426         lsd->lsd_client_start     = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_client_start);
00427         lsd->lsd_client_size      = le16_to_cpu(buf->lsd_client_size);
00428         lsd->lsd_subdir_count     = le16_to_cpu(buf->lsd_subdir_count);
00429         lsd->lsd_catalog_oid      = le64_to_cpu(buf->lsd_catalog_oid);
00430         lsd->lsd_catalog_ogen     = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_catalog_ogen);
00431         memcpy(lsd->lsd_peeruuid, buf->lsd_peeruuid, sizeof(lsd->lsd_peeruuid));
00432         lsd->lsd_osd_index        = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_osd_index);
00433         lsd->lsd_padding1        = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_padding1);
00434         lsd->lsd_start_epoch      = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_start_epoch);
00435         for (i = 0; i < LR_EXPIRE_INTERVALS; i++)
00436                 lsd->lsd_trans_table[i] = le64_to_cpu(buf->lsd_trans_table[i]);
00437         lsd->lsd_trans_table_time = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_trans_table_time);
00438         lsd->lsd_expire_intervals = le32_to_cpu(buf->lsd_expire_intervals);
00439 }
00440 
00441 static inline void lsd_cpu_to_le(struct lr_server_data *lsd,
00442                                  struct lr_server_data *buf)
00443 {
00444         int i;
00445         memcpy(buf->lsd_uuid, lsd->lsd_uuid, sizeof(buf->lsd_uuid));
00446         buf->lsd_last_transno     = cpu_to_le64(lsd->lsd_last_transno);
00447         buf->lsd_compat14         = cpu_to_le64(lsd->lsd_compat14);
00448         buf->lsd_mount_count      = cpu_to_le64(lsd->lsd_mount_count);
00449         buf->lsd_feature_compat   = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_feature_compat);
00450         buf->lsd_feature_rocompat = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_feature_rocompat);
00451         buf->lsd_feature_incompat = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_feature_incompat);
00452         buf->lsd_server_size      = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_server_size);
00453         buf->lsd_client_start     = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_client_start);
00454         buf->lsd_client_size      = cpu_to_le16(lsd->lsd_client_size);
00455         buf->lsd_subdir_count     = cpu_to_le16(lsd->lsd_subdir_count);
00456         buf->lsd_catalog_oid      = cpu_to_le64(lsd->lsd_catalog_oid);
00457         buf->lsd_catalog_ogen     = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_catalog_ogen);
00458         memcpy(buf->lsd_peeruuid, lsd->lsd_peeruuid, sizeof(buf->lsd_peeruuid));
00459         buf->lsd_osd_index        = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_osd_index);
00460         buf->lsd_padding1         = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_padding1);
00461         buf->lsd_start_epoch      = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_start_epoch);
00462         for (i = 0; i < LR_EXPIRE_INTERVALS; i++)
00463                 buf->lsd_trans_table[i] = cpu_to_le64(lsd->lsd_trans_table[i]);
00464         buf->lsd_trans_table_time = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_trans_table_time);
00465         buf->lsd_expire_intervals = cpu_to_le32(lsd->lsd_expire_intervals);
00466 }
00467 
00468 static inline void lcd_le_to_cpu(struct lsd_client_data *buf,
00469                                  struct lsd_client_data *lcd)
00470 {
00471         memcpy(lcd->lcd_uuid, buf->lcd_uuid, sizeof (lcd->lcd_uuid));
00472         lcd->lcd_last_transno       = le64_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_transno);
00473         lcd->lcd_last_xid           = le64_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_xid);
00474         lcd->lcd_last_result        = le32_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_result);
00475         lcd->lcd_last_data          = le32_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_data);
00476         lcd->lcd_last_close_transno = le64_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_close_transno);
00477         lcd->lcd_last_close_xid     = le64_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_close_xid);
00478         lcd->lcd_last_close_result  = le32_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_close_result);
00479         lcd->lcd_last_close_data    = le32_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_close_data);
00480         lcd->lcd_pre_versions[0]    = le64_to_cpu(buf->lcd_pre_versions[0]);
00481         lcd->lcd_pre_versions[1]    = le64_to_cpu(buf->lcd_pre_versions[1]);
00482         lcd->lcd_pre_versions[2]    = le64_to_cpu(buf->lcd_pre_versions[2]);
00483         lcd->lcd_pre_versions[3]    = le64_to_cpu(buf->lcd_pre_versions[3]);
00484         lcd->lcd_last_epoch         = le32_to_cpu(buf->lcd_last_epoch);
00485         lcd->lcd_generation         = le32_to_cpu(buf->lcd_generation);
00486 }
00487 
00488 static inline void lcd_cpu_to_le(struct lsd_client_data *lcd,
00489                                  struct lsd_client_data *buf)
00490 {
00491         memcpy(buf->lcd_uuid, lcd->lcd_uuid, sizeof (lcd->lcd_uuid));
00492         buf->lcd_last_transno       = cpu_to_le64(lcd->lcd_last_transno);
00493         buf->lcd_last_xid           = cpu_to_le64(lcd->lcd_last_xid);
00494         buf->lcd_last_result        = cpu_to_le32(lcd->lcd_last_result);
00495         buf->lcd_last_data          = cpu_to_le32(lcd->lcd_last_data);
00496         buf->lcd_last_close_transno = cpu_to_le64(lcd->lcd_last_close_transno);
00497         buf->lcd_last_close_xid     = cpu_to_le64(lcd->lcd_last_close_xid);
00498         buf->lcd_last_close_result  = cpu_to_le32(lcd->lcd_last_close_result);
00499         buf->lcd_last_close_data    = cpu_to_le32(lcd->lcd_last_close_data);
00500         buf->lcd_pre_versions[0]    = cpu_to_le64(lcd->lcd_pre_versions[0]);
00501         buf->lcd_pre_versions[1]    = cpu_to_le64(lcd->lcd_pre_versions[1]);
00502         buf->lcd_pre_versions[2]    = cpu_to_le64(lcd->lcd_pre_versions[2]);
00503         buf->lcd_pre_versions[3]    = cpu_to_le64(lcd->lcd_pre_versions[3]);
00504         buf->lcd_last_epoch         = cpu_to_le32(lcd->lcd_last_epoch);
00505         buf->lcd_generation         = cpu_to_le32(lcd->lcd_generation);
00506 }
00507 
00508 static inline __u64 lcd_last_transno(struct lsd_client_data *lcd)
00509 {
00510         return (lcd->lcd_last_transno > lcd->lcd_last_close_transno ?
00511                 lcd->lcd_last_transno : lcd->lcd_last_close_transno);
00512 }
00513 
00514 static inline __u64 lcd_last_xid(struct lsd_client_data *lcd)
00515 {
00516         return (lcd->lcd_last_xid > lcd->lcd_last_close_xid ?
00517                 lcd->lcd_last_xid : lcd->lcd_last_close_xid);
00518 }
00519

00522 
00523 struct ll_sb_info;
00524 
00525 struct lustre_sb_info {
00526         int                       lsi_flags;
00527         struct obd_device        *lsi_mgc;     /* mgc obd */
00528         struct lustre_mount_data *lsi_lmd;     /* mount command info */
00529         struct ll_sb_info        *lsi_llsbi;   /* add'l client sbi info */
00530         struct dt_device         *lsi_dt_dev;  /* dt device to access disk fs*/
00531         atomic_t                  lsi_mounts;  /* references to the srv_mnt */
00532         char                      lsi_svname[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00533         char                      lsi_osd_obdname[64];
00534         char                      lsi_osd_uuid[64];
00535         struct obd_export        *lsi_osd_exp;
00536         char                      lsi_osd_type[16];
00537         char                      lsi_fstype[16];
00538         struct backing_dev_info   lsi_bdi;     /* each client mountpoint needs
00539                                                   own backing_dev_info */
00540         struct list_head          lsi_lwp_list;
00541         spinlock_t                lsi_lwp_lock;
00542         unsigned long             lsi_lwp_started:1;
00543 };
00544 
00545 #define LSI_UMOUNT_FAILOVER              0x00200000
00546 #define LSI_BDI_INITIALIZED              0x00400000
00547 
00548 #define     s2lsi(sb)        ((struct lustre_sb_info *)((sb)->s_fs_info))
00549 #define     s2lsi_nocast(sb) ((sb)->s_fs_info)
00550 
00551 #define     get_profile_name(sb)   (s2lsi(sb)->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile)
00552 #define     get_mount_flags(sb)    (s2lsi(sb)->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags)
00553 #define     get_mntdev_name(sb)    (s2lsi(sb)->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev)
00554 #define     get_mount_fileset(sb)  (s2lsi(sb)->lsi_lmd->lmd_fileset)
